intro: Polygala extraaxillaris, commonly known as the extraaxillary milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, bean-like pods that contain seeds. Polygala extraaxillaris is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
